meanings.definition: To act in an excessively subservient manner.
meanings.sent1: She was always kowtowing to her boss, agreeing with everything he said.
meanings.sent2: The waiter kept kowtowing to the rude customer, hoping for a good tip.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to be kowtowing to the cat, bringing it toys and treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician was accused of kowtowing to the wealthy donors for campaign funds.
meanings.sent5: The student was tired of kowtowing to the teacher's unreasonable demands.

meanings.definition: A deep bow or act of kneeling in Chinese culture as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the ambassador performed a kowtowing to the emperor.
meanings.sent2: The traditional dance included a graceful kowtowing at the end.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they attempted a playful kowtowing to their grandparents.
meanings.sent4: The kowtowing of the martial arts master was a display of discipline and honor.
meanings.sent5: The kowtowing of the young couple to their elders symbolized their gratitude and reverence.
